newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real rises 0.01 pct in bland trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real rises 0.01 pct in bland trade.

text.p: Brazil's real closed up 0.01 percent at 1.0246 per greenback in bland trade on the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The Central Bank bought dollars at 1.0245 real per greenback to drain excess dollars from the market in the late afternoon.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Thursday surplus of $10 million.
On Wednesday, net dollar flows posted a $173.9 million surplus, contrary to market expectations of a deficit throughout that day.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real ended at 1.0304 per dollar, up 0.01 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real fell 1.42 percent to close at 1.075 real per greenback, mostly due to a continued reduction in the supply of dollars, traders said.
